meanings.sent1: After her divorce, she decided to remarry her high school sweetheart.
meanings.sent2: It is common for widows and widowers to remarry later in life.
meanings.sent3: The idea of her pet goldfish wanting to remarry its fishbowl was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to remarry the horizon as it dipped below the skyline.
meanings.sent5: The old tree stump looked like it was ready to remarry the earth with its roots.

meanings.definition: To enter into a marriage with a new spouse after the end of a previous marriage.
meanings.sent1: She was excited to remarry and start a new chapter in her life.
meanings.sent2: After her divorce, she found love again and decided to remarry.
meanings.sent3: The idea of her cat wanting to remarry its favorite toy mouse was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the sunset seemed to remarry the sky in a beautiful display.
meanings.sent5: The river eagerly awaited to remarry the ocean, flowing with determination.
